comment.text: This translation key is used for a checkbox label that enables or disables certificate verification in the DocumentService settings. It appears as a label on a checkbox within a UI component. Translators should provide an equivalent phrase indicating that certificate verification is insecure.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "Sertifikat doğrulamasını deaktiv edin (təhlükəsiz deyil)" is technically correct but could be improved for naturalness. 'Təhlükəsiz deyil' is a literal translation of 'insecure' and a more idiomatic phrase would be better.

The translation "Ota varmenteen vahvistus (epävarma) pois käytöstä" is a literal translation of 'Disable certificate verification (insecure)' but sounds unnatural in Finnish.  A more natural and idiomatic translation would be something along the lines of 'Poista varmenteiden tarkistus käytöstä (turvaton)'.
The parenthesis around 'epävarma' are unnecessary and break the flow of the sentence. In the suggested correction, the parenthetical explanation is integrated into the phrasing, 'turvaton'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the parentheses from the original translation or the suggested correction if it isn't incorporated into the phrase.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Japanese translation "メール認証を無効にする" (meeru shoukai o mukyou ni suru) translates to "Disable email authentication". The English content refers to disabling certificate verification, which is a different concept. The translation doesn't convey the intended meaning.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 証明書検証を無効にする (shoumeisho kenshou o mukyou ni suru) - This translates to 'Disable certificate verification'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "인증서 인증 비활성화(안전하지 않습니다)" is technically correct, but could be improved for clarity and naturalness. '인증' is used twice, which can be redundant.  A more natural phrasing would avoid repetition.
The parenthesis placement could be improved for better readability.  While technically correct, it is not the most common way to format such a message.
The Lao word 'ປິດ' (pit) is correctly spelled.
The Lao word 'ການກວດກາ' (kaan gwat ga) is correctly spelled.
The Lao word 'ໃບຢັ້ງຢືນ' (lai yang yang yuun) is correctly spelled.
The Lao word 'ບໍ່ປອດໄພ' (bor bpor sai) is correctly spelled.

While grammatically correct, the translation 'ປິດການກວດກາໃບຢັ້ງຢືນ (ບໍ່ປອດໄພ)' is a very literal translation and may not convey the nuance of 'Disable certificate verification (insecure)' effectively. A more natural or idiomatic Lao translation might be preferable.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider alternatives like 'ຢັ້ງຢືນບໍ່ໃຊ້ (ບໍ່ປອດໄພ)' or 'ເຊື່ອຖືໃບຢັ້ງຢືນแบบไม่ปลอดภัย' depending on the desired level of formality and target audience.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "ආරක්ෂාව නැත" (aaraksawa nathe) literally translates to 'security is not there' which is an awkward phrasing. A more natural translation for 'insecure' in this context would be something like 'අනතුරු ඇත්තේ' (anadaru athte) - meaning 'there is danger' or 'vulnerable'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: පහත්පත්ර සත්‍යාපනය අක්‍රීය කරන්න (අනතුරු ඇත්තේ) / පහත්පත්ර සත්‍යාපනය අක්‍රීය කරන්න (ආතතියක් විය හැක)

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Onemogući verifikaciju sertifikata (nebezbedno)' is a technically correct translation, but 'nebezbedno' (unsafe) is a slightly less precise and less commonly used phrasing in this context. A more natural and accurate translation for 'insecure' in this context would be 'poverljivo' or 'nepouzdan'.

The translation 'Sertifika doğrulamasını devre dışı bırak (güvenli değil)' is a literal translation but could be improved for clarity and naturalness in Turkish. While technically correct, it sounds slightly awkward.
